issue.title: configure error on 32-bit Ubuntu Saucy
issue.body:
checking for main in -lminiupnpc... (cached) yes
checking for boostlib >= 1.20.0... yes
checking whether the Boost::System library is available... yes
configure: error: Could not find a version of the library!
make[1]: **\* [override_dh_auto_configure] Error 1

works on amd64, however...

See https://launchpadlibrarian.net/170491643/buildlog_ubuntu-saucy-i386.bitcoin_0.9.0-saucy1_FAILEDTOBUILD.txt.gz

events.body: Quite possibly me missing something, but that error message is completely indecipherable.
The above log is all I have, sorry.
If I have time, I'll try to rerun the build with a cat config.log at the end.
Usually this means that boost libraries are installed in multiple locations, and autoconf picks the wrong location. You could --with-boost-libdir=<dir> to explicitly set a directory.

http://git.savannah.gnu.org/cgit/autoconf-archive.git/commit/m4/ax_boost_base.m4?id=7a97956f261a43897e88c14ef3b2f650fadc8556

Updating to #serial 23 should fix. Will PR it.
@TheBlueMatt This should fix your issue, but I'm unable to test. Could you please confirm?

Nope, this bug still exists on both saucy and trusty:
https://launchpad.net/~bitcoin/+archive/bitcoin/+packages
@TheBlueMatt Could you please grab a config.log for this?
I've tried to reproduce this, finally managed to extract the config.log from the pbuilder environment. See here: http://pastebin.com/ML1PYR93
Debian is building 0.9.1 which didn't get 13a2283a6. 0.9.2 contains it, so that should work. @floe unless you're able to reproduce with the 0.9.2 branch or rc tags, this has been taken care of.
@TheBlueMatt could you push new packages for 0.9.2 to your PPA? Would probably be the quickest way to test this.
0.9.2 final is not released yet, so pushing packages for it makes no sense. We've never done PPAs for release candidates.
@laanwj oops, my bad. will test on my machine, then.
@theuni: I had tried with 13a2283, but that did not resolve the problem. Have there been any other changes which could effect this?
No, that should do it. You made sure to re-run autogen.sh ?
yea, they all run from a clean state.
